case_vignette: An elderly man presents with asymptomatic hyperpigmented, confluent, brown macules on his upper and lower lips, along with hyperpigmented macules on his hands. He also has diffuse blue-black bilateral melanonychia with nail dystrophy on his toenails, and his fingernails contain longitudinal melanonychia with hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail beds. He denies any family history of mucocutaneous pigmentation or gastrointestinal or systemic symptoms. In the last 5 years, results of a colonoscopy, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, and blood work have all been within normal limits. He has a history of smoking and has smoked for 30 years. He has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, but is currently on medication for these conditions. He has a history of a previous melanoma, but this was excised 10 years ago. multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
Hello! I have noticed brown spots on my upper and lower lips and also on my hands. Additionally, my toenails and fingernails both have a blue-black coloration and some changes in their shape.
Have these symptoms appeared suddenly or developed gradually over time?
These symptoms have developed gradually over time.
Do you have any other skin changes or symptoms elsewhere on your body?
No, I do not have any other skin changes or symptoms elsewhere on my body.
Do you have any existing health issues or are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I have hypertension and hyperlipidemia, and I am currently on medication for these conditions.
Is there any family history of similar symptoms or any other relevant genetic conditions?
No, there is no family history of similar symptoms or any relevant genetic conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Peutz-Jeghers Syndrome.
